channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sterling Rises to 2.5-Year High Versus Euro After Strong U.K. Retail Sales
item.description: Sterling rose to its strongest level against the euro in two-and-a-half years after U.K. retail sales data suggested the country’s economy could be pe...

item.title: Can Netflix Keep Flexing Its Pricing Muscle?
item.description: The streaming giant’s ad business is taking time to catch on, which will make price hikes unavoidable if subscriber growth slows.

item.title: Netflix third-quarter subscribers barely beat estimates as ad-tier members jump 35%
item.description: Netflix's ad-tier memberships jumped 35%. The company is on track to launch the service in Canada in the coming quarter and more broadly in 2025.

item.title: ASML just gave us a first glimpse into how U.S. chip export curbs will dent its China sales
item.description: ASML on Tuesday offered the first glimpse into how U.S. restrictions on exports of its advanced chip manufacturing tools to China will impact its sale...

item.title: A Mystery $30 Million Wave of Pro-Trump Bets Has Moved a Popular Prediction Market
item.description: Four Polymarket accounts have systematically placed frequent bets on a Trump election victory.

item.title: Morgan Stanley shares pop 7% after beating estimates for third-quarter profit and revenue
item.description: Morgan Stanley has several tail winds in its favor, from high stock values to a rebound in investment banking and strong trading activity.

item.title: Stock Futures Rise as Netflix Stock Jumps on Earnings
item.description: Futures tied to the S&P 500 and Nasdaq-100 rose while stocks in Chinas rallied.

item.title: Nvidia and Apple supplier TSMC shares pop after quarterly profit soars on AI demand
item.description: TSMC, the world’s largest producer of advanced chips, posted a 54% hike in third-quarter profit.

item.title: Here's a rapid-fire update on all 33 portfolio stocks, including our 2 newest positions
item.description: Jim Cramer broke down each holding Wednesday during the October Monthly Meeting.

item.title: Oil Steady But on Track for Significant Weekly Loss
item.description: Oil prices were broadly stable in early European trading with concerns over sluggish demand in China weighed heavily on prices, but crude still findin...
